moves.1. e4: This annotation is done purely to analyse the endgame plan beginning around move 48
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 Nf6: From here the plan begins to take shape. I have 2 options with the f and b pawns.
moves.48... Kf5 49. Kxh5 Kxf4+: White obligingly allows me to get my K into position.
moves.50. Kg6 f5 51. Kh5 Kf3 52. Kg6 f4 53. Kf: Now i am faced with the perennial problem that K R & pawn endgames are quite often a draw. So how to exchange Rs without spoiling my plans
moves.53... Rc1 54. Ke5 Re1+ 55. Kf5 Rf1 56. R: The game losing move as white again obliges by gifting me the R exchange
White resigned here after offering a draw??? Play would continue
moves.62. Kb5 Kxb2 63. Kxa5: Alternative variation: 63. Kc4 [white tries to protect the b-pawn but Kc2 restablishes opposition and he has to move away.] Kc2 64. Kb5 Kxb3
